description: over- +‎ tone, calque of German Oberton.

entries.meaning: (physics, music) A tone whose frequency is an integer multiple of another; a member of the harmonic series. [from 1867]
(figuratively, often in the plural) An implicit message (in a film, book, verbal discussion or similar) perceived as overwhelming the explicit message. [from 1890]

verbs.description: overtone (third-person singular simple present overtones, present participle overtoning, simple past and past participle overtoned)

examples: The flesh tints appear to have been darkened by being overworked; the draperies are overtoned in the same way  […]
